meanings.definition: In or toward the middle of a structure or body
meanings.sent1: The doctor injected the medicine medially into the patient's arm.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon made an incision medially along the spine.
meanings.sent3: The sandwich was stacked medially with all the toppings in the center.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed medially through the valley, dividing it in half.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a line medially on the canvas, creating balance in the composition.

meanings.definition: In a medial direction or position
meanings.sent1: She moved the book medially on the shelf to make space for more.
meanings.sent2: The dancer gracefully leaped medially across the stage.
meanings.sent3: The cat stretched out medially on the windowsill, enjoying the warm sun.
meanings.sent4: The runner veered medially towards the finish line, determined to win.
meanings.sent5: The tree branches reached medially towards the sky, seeking sunlight.
